analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Markets show MIXED conviction with bearish structural concerns (record global debt, regulatory tightening, earnings downgrades) offsetting bullish forward narratives (AI adoption, rate relief potential). Conviction: MEDIUM. Near-term downside bias dominates, but institutional accumulation on weakness suggests tactical nature of selloff.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) Regulatory headwinds in banking/enterprise software creating near-term earnings pressure; (2) AI and autonomous vehicle adoption narrative remains intact but faces 2026 timing dependency; (3) Rate policy uncertainty and Fed communication clarity as near-term pivot catalyst; (4) Cryptocurrency volatility and leveraged position liquidation risk; (5) Year-end options expiry volatility in equities and crypto indices.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.31): Call Wall $700 (146k OI - active hedging, 1.4% away), Put Wall $640 (153k OI - dormant support, 7.3% away). Max Pain $686. Near support: $670 (45k OI, active at 2.9% away), $645 (126k OI, dormant). QQQ ($623.89): Call Wall $630 (33k OI - active, 1.0% away), Put Wall $590 (164k OI - dormant, 5.4% away). Max Pain $621. Near resistance: $640 (31k OI), $625 (29k OI - both active). Per Twitter sources: /ES support cited at 6550 level (broader correction threshold).
key_themes: AI commercialization progress vs. timing dependency
risk_factors: Record $346 trillion global debt creating deleveraging cascade risk if volatility accelerates
Cryptocurrency whale liquidation pressure ($53M underwater positions) could trigger forced selling
Regulatory tightening in banking supervisory framework creating near-term constraint on financial sector
Year-end options expiry volatility amplifying price swings in both directions
Geopolitical escalation (Ukraine, Taiwan) as hidden tail risk triggering risk-off acceleration
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Test $700 call wall as immediate resistance (active hedging zone). Hold above $670 (active support, 2.9% below current) to avoid accelerating toward $645. QQQ: Resistance at $625 and $630 call wall (both active). Support at $590 put wall if sharper decline triggers. Watch for breakdown through active support levels as signal of cascading weakness.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Primary downside target $640 put wall (dormant support, 7.3% away). If that breaks, secondary support at $645 (126k OI). Upside limited to $700 call wall (active resistance). QQQ: Primary support at $590 put wall (164k OI, significant). Resistance at $630 call wall. Consolidation likely between $625-$640 range before directional resolve. Max Pain gravitational pull: SPY $686, QQQ $621 - expect mean-reversion bias toward these strikes through expiration window.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
